intro: Labatia parinarioides, commonly known as the red-flowered labatia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Labatia parinarioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
